content.description: Start standing(ish) at an obvious crack and move directly up. Hard to describe, skip to 3:50 in the video below for beta.Beta
content.protection: Pads. It’s pretty hard to protect effectively, to be honest. Your climbing ability is the best pro.
content.location: Right side of the boulder- not the obvious hand crack, but starts in the crack to the left and goes more or less straight up.

content.description: Start sitting as deep as possible in the obvious pit at the bottom of the boulder. Follow the obvious crack up and left until you reach a horizontal. Traverse left along the horizontal until you can step off, just around where the red graffiti is. There are two obvious lowest handholds and a large left foot. The lowest options for right feet suck. All rocks to all sides are off.
content.protection: Pads- maybe. The bottom is too lowball to pad, really, and the landing for the top traverse is just bad. Don’t fall after the bottom?

content.description: Start as for Pinball Falls, but instead of exiting left finish straight up the brain-coral-esque slab. Do not fall at the top. Robin Close and I are pretty sure about this being an FA, if it isn’t, please let me know.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5_3VcPNHWO8
content.protection: I put one pad down but honestly, it seemed pretty futile to try. Don’t fall.
content.location: Start as for Pinball, finish straight up.

pathTokens: North Bank - Chaos Roof Area AKA Snowflake Boulder

content.description: A unique boulder riddled with some funky cracks. Very close to the Ultimate Doom boulder, but not visible from the same. The landing is very bad and the bottom of the (in my opinion) coolest boulders is probably wet quite often. Doesn’t get much traffic. Bring your head game.
